conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

Thank you again for considering me in prior rounds. I remain very interested in School_C and want to understand whether there is any realistic path to admission if circumstances change (e.g., if higher-priority candidates accept elsewhere).

If you’re able to share, what is the main factor keeping my application from being competitive right now (fit, specific academic profile, or simply capacity/priority order)? If there is any additional document or update you would like (recent grades, activities, statement of fit), I can provide it immediately.

I appreciate your time and guidance.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: School_C is my top true preference and the only unmatched school available this round. Although I was rejected twice, I should continue to signal strong commitment and ask what specific profile they still need or whether there is any possibility if their top candidates choose other options. Using [TALK] can reopen dialogue without forcing another immediate accept/reject, and may elicit information or keep me on their radar for a future reconsideration.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful message and for your continued interest in School_C.

At this stage, the main factor is capacity and our priority order rather than any specific concern about your fit or profile. With only one seat available, we need to reserve flexibility in case higher-priority candidates engage with us in upcoming rounds.

That said, circumstances can change from round to round. If you remain interested, please do continue to check in—especially by sending an [APPLY] in a future round if School_C is still your top choice. If you have any meaningful updates (new grades, a notable achievement, or a brief statement clarifying why School_C is the best fit), you’re welcome to share them; while priority is the binding constraint, additional information can still be helpful for context if we are able to make an offer later.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

It’s plausible B could come to us if rejected/waitlisted by School_A, and A could come if not placed at A/B. Therefore, continue dialogue without accepting. Student_C asked for transparency; respond that it’s primarily priority/capacity, encourage them to keep us in consideration and apply again, and optionally provide updates. Use [TALK] as required.

conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I should continue to apply each round to be considered immediately if higher-priority students match elsewhere. Message should be concise, reaffirm immediate acceptance, and note file is complete to reduce any friction if they can offer the seat this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your continued commitment to School_C and for your patience throughout the process. Given the current circumstances and our available seat, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

Please confirm acceptance today, as you indicated, and we will finalize the match.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is ranked 3rd on our true priority list. We have repeatedly rejected to preserve the single seat for higher-priority candidates (Student_A or Student_B). However, by round 14 no higher-priority candidate has contacted us, and Student_C has consistently applied with a credible commitment to accept immediately. Holding out longer risks ending unmatched or being forced to accept an even lower-priority student later (Student_D/E) if they appear, while Student_C is already available now. Given the late stage and strong demonstrated interest, accepting Student_C now maximizes expected outcome subject to quota 1.
